intro: Stigmatosema cotylolabium, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a slender, upright stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Stigmatosema cotylolabium is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its showy, bell-like blooms.
